p: Samples taken from people and animals with suspected monkeypox virus infection should be handled by trained staff working in Biosafety Level 3 (BSL-3/ABSL-3) containment laboratories (CDC 2007). Orthopoxviruses are susceptible to 0.5Â % sodium hypochlorite, chloroxylenol-based household disinfectants, glutaraldehyde, formaldehyde, and paraformaldehyde; and are inactivated by heat (autoclaving and incineration) (Butcher and Ulaeto 2005). Orthopoxviruses are stable at ambient temperatures when dried (CDC 2007) .
